entry.title: Google employees are comparing their salary details in a bid to be fairly paid
entry.summary: "Fighting for justice and fairness inside Google doesn't go over well. Salary sharing is only one example," she said.

entry.title: Google's second quarter: What to watch
entry.summary: Analysts expect Google to earn $6.70 a share, excluding certain expenses, according to Thomson Reuters.

entry.title: Google getting whipped into shape by Wall Street veteran Ruth Porat
entry.summary:
Not only was she a chief financial officer and former head of Morgan Stanley's financial institutions group, but she had worked on many technology deals as a mergers and acquisitions specialist, including Google's initial public stock offering.

Pitz worked with Porat during the eight years he was a research analyst at Morgan Stanley, including the time when Google went public.

entry.title: Review: Google Photos is strong on search
entry.summary: This product image provided by Google shows the collections feature of the Google Photos mobile app.

entry.title: Review: Google photo service is strong on search
entry.summary:
Photo services from Google, Yahoo and Apple all store copies of those photos and video online.

The latest offering, Google Photos, isn't perfect.

Google and Apple use face-recognition technology to sort photos by individuals, while Yahoo knows only that there's someone there - not who.

entry.title: Review: Google photo service is strong on search
entry.summary:
On the other hand, Google has the best tools for searching photos.

Here's a look at Google Photos and how it compares with Apple's and Yahoo's offerings.

Photos and video on your device will automatically upload to Google's servers.

Google, Apple and Yahoo use computer software to tag photos to help you find them more easily.

entry.title: Google Maps Now Shows You Everywhere You've Been
Google's new "timeline" feature
Google gains billions in value as YouTube drives ad growth
entry.summary:
The rise in Google's market value was more than the total market capitalization of Caterpillar Inc (CAT.N), the world's biggest construction equipment maker.

Google's shares hit a record high of $703, valuing it at $471.50 billion and cementing its position as the world's second most valuable company after Apple Inc (AAPL.O).

Up to Friday's close, Google shares had risen about 32 percent this year.

entry.title: Google self-driving car was rear-ended early July, causing injuries
entry.summary: "Our self-driving cars are being hit surprisingly often by other drivers who are distracted and not paying attention to the road," wrote Chris Urmson, director of Google's self-driving car project, in the blog post.

entry.title: Google gains billions in value as YouTube drives ad growth
entry.summary: Google's class A shares chalked up their largest single-day percentage change in more than seven years on Friday.

entry.title: Google shareholders revel in record 1-day windfall of $65.1B
entry.summary:
Google's stock roared out of a long slumber Friday to produce the biggest shareholder windfall in U.S. history as investors rewarded the Internet company for promising to curb its spending on risky projects.

A 16 percent surge in Google's publicly traded stock translated into an additional $65.1 billion in shareholder wealth, on paper at least.

The company's inability to hit the targets that steer investors had raised doubts about Google that had caused its stock to lag the rest of the market since the end of 2013.

The words placated investors who had become increasingly frustrated with Google's penchant for spending on projects that had little or nothing to do with its man business of Internet search and advertising - areas that the company has long dominated.

Although Google has still been making plenty of money, many investors believed the company needed to clamp down on expenses.

entry.title: Google shares gain a record $65B in value
entry.summary:
The combined gains include Google Inc.'s Class A and non-voting Class C shares.

Google's Class A shares gained $97.84, or 16.3 percent, to close at $699.62.

entry.title: Google shares gain a record $65B in value
entry.summary: Google's Class C shares rose 16.1 percent to $672.93.

Google blames humans for self-driving crashes - again
entry.summary: DETROIT - One of Google Inc's self-driving cars was involved in an accident early in July, in which three employees were injured when a vehicle equipped with Google technology was rear-ended by another vehicle, the company said.

entry.title: Google self-driving car was rear-ended early July, causing injuries
Etsy shares spike after Google mention
entry.summary:
Shares of e-commerce website Etsy jumped as much as 30 percent on Friday thanks to a nod from Google during its quarterly conference call.

"It started with (the) Google commentary last night," Wedbush analyst Gil Luria said, adding that short sellers closing their bets were driving the stock up further.

entry.title: Google shares soar as YouTube growth allays fears over Facebook
Google boosts Nasdaq futures; Dow, S&P flat
entry.summary: * Google jumped 12 percent to $674.55, poised to open at a record high, a day after its profit beat forecasts for the first time in six quarters and the company said it would be more disciplined on spending.

entry.title: Google employees injured when self-driving SUV rear-ended
entry.summary: The Google car and the other car in front of it also stopped.

entry.title: Cr-ouch! Google self-driving car has first injury accident
entry.summary: Google has said that its car has not caused any of the collisions, though in 2011 an employee who took a car to run an errand rear-ended another vehicle while the Google car was out of self-driving mode.

entry.title: Google self-driving car involved in first injury accident
entry.summary:
Google revealed Thursday that one of its self-driving car prototypes was involved in an injury accident for the first time.

In the collision, a Lexus SUV that the tech giant outfitted with sensors and cameras was rear-ended in Google's home city of Mountain View, where more than 20 prototypes have been self-maneuvering through traffic.

Google's SUV was going about 15 mph in self-driving mode behind two other cars as the group approached an intersection with a green light.

entry.title: Google's 2Q signals new era of austerity with new CFO
entry.summary: Expenses now seem more likely to rise at or below the pace of Google's revenue increases, based on Porat's remarks to analysts Thursday.

entry.title: Google wins dismissal of Android privacy lawsuit
Google wins dismissal of Android privacy lawsuit
entry.summary:
Google did not immediately respond to a similar request.

Grewal said it would unfairly prejudice Google to let the plaintiffs amend their lawsuit again.

The case is In re: Google Inc Privacy Policy Litigation, U.S. District Court, Northern District of California, No.

entry.title: Google unveils buying button in mobile shopping ads
entry.summary:
The feature, called "Purchases on Google," completes sales using financial information that already has been stored with Google.

Participating merchants can still gather information about customers using Google's buying button.

About a dozen retailers are initially using Google's buying button.

entry.title: Google unveils buying button in mobile shopping ads
entry.summary: Google is introducing a way for shoppers browsing on their smartphones to buy merchandise by tapping on a button included in the ads appearing in its search results.

entry.title: Google unveils buying button in mobile shopping ads
Google Unveils 'Buy' Button, Host of New Shopping Features
entry.summary: The eagerly awaited "buy" feature, which Google said it was testing with a few retailers, uses saved payment credentials from the user s Google Account for transactions.

entry.title: Google unveils 'buy' button, new shopping features
entry.summary:
Google on Wednesday unveiled a new feature called "Purchases on Google," which allows shopper to buy items directly from mobile search ads.

Google also said its Google Now service is offering location-based information, including on discounts on items and the working hours of stores a user is close to.

entry.title: Google Photos uploads pics even after you uninstall
entry.summary: (Go to Google Settings > Google Photo Backup.)

entry.title: Google tests driverless cars in Austin _ with safety drivers
entry.summary: Google did not say exactly where the driverless cars would be tested.

entry.title: Google testing self-driving prototype cars in Texas
entry.summary:
Google and other automotive manufacturers and suppliers have said the technology to build self-driving cars should be ready by 2020.

Google executives have said the company does not want to build its own self-driving cars, but would prefer to find a development and production partner.

entry.title: Google Inc?s Waze mapping company to launch carpooling pilot program in Israel
entry.summary: Google bought Israel-based Waze, which uses satellite signals from members' smartphones to offer real-time traffic information, for about US$1 billion two years ago.

entry.title: Google Tests Carpooling Service for Commuters in Israel
